description._content: Author: Tolman, Ruel P (Ruel Pardee) b. 1878 Type: Photographic print     Person, candid Date: 1935 Topic: Uniforms      Men      Plumbers Standard number: SIA2011-0907 and 32135-6 Physical description: Number of Images: 1; Color: Black and white; Size: 2.125w x 2.25h; Type of Image: Person, candid; Medium: Photographic print Category: Historic Images of the Smithsonian Notes: The image is included in Tolman's scrapbook of photographs of Smithsonian staff, grounds and buildings, exhibitions, and Washington, D.C. scenes, (Section F) Summary: Mr. Farrell and Mr. Keefer sitting. Mr. Farrell (left) is identified as a plumber. Mr. Keefer (right) is wearing a uniform. An exposed pipe can be seen in the background and standing in a lab. A shelf filled with bottles and an exposed electric light bulb can be seen in the background Persistent URL:Link to data base record Repository:Smithsonian Archives - History Div View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
